intro: Gireoudia vitifolia, commonly known as the grape-leaved gireoudia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that resemble those of grapevines, hence its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Native to parts of southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Gireoudia vitifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and modest floral display.
